intro: Quamoclidion froebelii, commonly known as the froebel's quamoclidion, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with four petals. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the tropical rainforests. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, with a glossy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
